title: System requirements
content:
The Kubernetes instance embedded in OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT) is also known as the "embedded Kubernetes." When planning a new installation or an upgrade of an existing deployment that uses the embedded Kubernetes, review the following support matrix information.

We always recommend that you follow the installation instructions and install the latest version of the suite. If you have a reason to install an older release, please contact our product management team. 
Version with .n in the support matrix means that all sub-versions of that major version are supported.

Compute environments

You can deploy the OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT) cluster in the following computing environments.

Bare metal

See below for the supported operating systems.

Hypervisors

  • Virtualization – see below
  • Virtual Machine host operating systems - see below
VMware ESXi and Microsoft Windows Hyper-V are validated platforms. Other virtualization platforms are technically supported, but haven't been validated by OpenText. When using VMware to deploy the suite, don't allow automated migration for virtual machines hosting the suite, to avoid unexpected downtime. For more information, see Configure DRS for virtual machines hosting the suite.

Operating systems

The control plane and worker node hosts must run the same operating system. The following section lists the supported operating systems.

Operating System (OS) versions listed in this section use the .x format (for example, 8.x) to indicate that all minor versions available at the time of Service Management release are supported. For example, within the 8.x series of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), if versions 8.8 and 8.9 were available at Service Management release time, only these versions are supported. Versions released later, such as RHEL 8.11, are not supported. For information on Service Management release dates, see Product Support Lifecycle.

Load balancers

The following load balancers have been verified and will be supported

  • Nginx
  • F5
  • Apache web server

Any other types of commercial load balancers that support layer four to layer seven and are not verified by OpenText would remain transparent to the product architecture. OpenText will accept support cases and troubleshoot them with a best effort approach. This might lead OpenText to refer back to the provider of the load balancer or a fully supported load balancer by OpenText.

Helm

Version 3.17.n

Databases

The following section lists the supported external databases for the production environment:

The notation .n implies that all sub-versions of the major version are supported

  • PostgreSQL versions: 17.n, 16.n, 15.n, 14.n for Linux
  • AlloyDB Omni versions: 16.n, 15.n (for PostgreSQL). Support for AlloyDB Omni is under controlled availability. Contact our product management team before your implementation.
  • Vertica versions: Since FinOps is configured in Operations Platform (OP) mode, refer to the support matrix of OP 25.3 

NFS

Supported NFS versions: v4.2, v4.1, v4.0

Supported NFS storage types:

  • Self-hosted NFS storage (Linux-based)
  • Managed NFS storage

For more information, see Configure NFS Volume

LDAP servers

You can configure LDAP authentication in the IdM Admin Portal or configure LDAP integration by using the OPB Agent. 

LDAP authentication in IdM

Technically, LDAP authentication in the IdM Admin Portal supports all external LDAP servers. The following are certified LDAP servers:

  • OpenLDAP 

  • Microsoft Active Directory 

OPB-based LDAP integration

The supported LDAP servers are:

  • Microsoft Active Directory 2016

  • Microsoft Active Directory 2019

  • Microsoft Active Directory 2022

  • Apache DS 2.0

Federated Identity technologies

This release supports the following federated identity technologies, using the IdM service embedded in the suite as a Service Provider (SP). 

SAML 2.0

Technically, the suite supports all SAML 2.0 compliant Identity Providers (IdPs). The following IdPs are the ones certified in the lab: 

  • Microsoft ADFS 3,0, 4.0

  • Azure AD

  • Okta

OAuth 2.0

Technically, the suite supports all OAuth 2.0 compliant Identity Providers (IdPs). The following IdPs are the ones certified in the lab:

  • MITREid Connect

  • Google

UI fonts

In the Agent interface:

  • For Russian and Greek, the UI is displayed with the Arial font.

  • For all other languages (including the languages added through Open L10N), the UI is displayed with the Metric font.

In the Service Portal interface:

The UI is displayed with the Roboto font for all languages.

On the use of Arial font: It is the customer’s responsibility to ensure that they have obtained a valid license for the Arial font when using this software. The software does not include or provide the Arial font, and its availability or licensing is not covered under the terms of use for this product. Customers are advised to consult their font provider or system administrator to confirm font licensing and installation before use.

Aviator language support

The support for all languages other than English has the following limitations:

  • The time Aviator takes to respond or react in these languages is slower compared to the response time in the English language.

  • The display language of the reference title and the content within it may not be consistent.

In the 25.2 P1 release, the Aviator's translation capabilities have been enhanced to support Arabic, Japanese, and Russian languages.

Virtual agent language support

The smart virtual agent allows the use of multiple language models within one single tenant.

The normal virtual agent uses an IDOL engine that can provide answers in all languages that the suite supports, based on content found in Knowledge, Catalog, Q&A, and Public Requests records.

Arabic/Hebrew support

The agent interface supports a right-to-left (RTL) layout for RTL languages. However, there are some limitations for certain UI elements in the RTL layout:

  • RTL support isn’t available for the Expression Language. The related UI elements are always left-to-right aligned when you view or edit the expressions.

  • RTL support isn’t available for some chart elements.

  • When a long text string is being truncated due to overflowing, the truncated text is left-to-right aligned.

  • RTL support isn’t available on the Smart Analytics Settings and  Virtual Agent Settings pages.

  • In RTL mode, you can't drag and drop columns in a grid view.

  • In RTL mode, if you have the Remove action and Add action for grid columns in one operation, for example, if you remove a column and add another column and then save the changes, the newly added column appears on the right side.

  • When the email receiver's language is set as Arabic or Hebrew, the "From email", "From name", and "Subject" fields in an email template won't be converted to the RTL layout. This is because the three fields are defined in Studio rather than in the email template. 

  • The DSL expression in the RTL email template isn't properly displayed, for example: {entity.Description:}$, but this layout issue won't affect the expression parse.

Portuguese (Portugal) support

The exported file of record history doesn't support Portuguese (Portugal).

Optical character recognition (OCR)

The OCR feature supports all languages that the Service Portal supports.

OMT Management Portal

The OMT Management Portal always supports the English character set in addition to the character set of the local operating system. For example, if you install OMT in a French environment, you can use both the English and French character sets.

Integrations

The suite supports integrations with many of our software products and third-party products. To view the support matrix information of these integrations, visit the Integration Central website.
